instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3926, startup chime, no boot.
threads.message: Hey guys, I have a 820-3926 here that has startup chime but, doesn't boot. I even tried booting with an external hard drive and also resetting the NVRAM, neither solved the issue, all it gives me is a plain white screen. Any further troubleshooting advice?

threads.title: 820-3926, startup chime, no boot.
threads.message: Have you tried an external display ?

threads.title: 820-3926, startup chime, no boot.
threads.message: Tried an external display however it makes no difference as the white screen is still present

threads.title: 820-3926, startup chime, no boot.
threads.message: Let me ask again....what the fuck is an 820-3926?

threads.title: 820-3926, startup chime, no boot.
threads.message: Hi Duke, Sorry for the mistake.  My tech guy who works for me had a type error.  The actual board number is 820-2936-B.  We even tried connecting the Macbook Pro to an external screen and still we are getting a white screen.  Tried booting with an external hard drive. No Results.  Pressed CMD + R to see if it takes us to the recovery mode, but nothing.  All it gives is a White Screen.  Could you please advice any troubleshooting steps. Raj.

threads.title: 820-3926, startup chime, no boot.
threads.message: Disconnected everything but the LCD? PRAM reset works?
